main event: A civilian observed a brilliant red light-like object hovering over the ocean near Oahu on April 16, 1954.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for about 1Â½ minutes before speeding off at a high rate of speed,It was observed at an altitude of approximately 3,000 to 4,000 feet,While moving, the object had a tail of light like a comet's tail,No other corroborating reports were made at the time,The U.S. Weather Station reported very good visibility and weather conditions during the sighting.
witness description: a civilian employed at a Hawaiian Sugar Company
